titleNullable: Theory of mind in remitted bipolar disorder
subtitleNullable: Interpersonal accuracy in recognition of dynamic nonverbal signals
descriptionNullable:
### Context

This dataset was analized in this publication: Espinós U, Fernández-Abascal EG, Ovejero M (2019) Theory of mind in remitted
bipolar disorder: Interpersonal accuracy in recognition of dynamic nonverbal signals. PLoS ONE 14(9): e0222112. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0222112


### Content
Dataset contains these variables:

- Group: Bipolar, Control, Depressive.
- Type: BD I, BD II, Control, Depressive.
- Right_answers: Number of right answers to the Mini PONS assessment.
- MiniPONS assessment scales 
1. Audio_prosody
2. Combined_channel
3. Face_video
4. Body_video
5. Positive_valence
6. Negative_valence	
7. Dominant	
8. Submissive
A higher score in those scales means a better performance.

### Acknowledgements

The authors would like to thank the participants whose contribution made this study possible. We also especially thank Elena Porras, who helped to recruit research participants


### Inspiration

This dataset may help people who are starting with data analysis and want to perform basic ANOVA and ANCOVA.
